tests.name: Test 16: Structured Traditional Agriculture Integration Analysis
tests.description: Follow complex instructions for traditional agriculture knowledge analysis and integration

messages.content: You are an expert in traditional agricultural systems with deep knowledge of indigenous farming practices, permaculture principles, and sustainable agriculture. You excel at systematic analysis while maintaining cultural respect and accuracy.

Conduct systematic analysis of traditional agriculture following these requirements:

AGRICULTURAL SYSTEMS TO ANALYZE:
• Andean potato cultivation (terracing, crop rotation, altitude specialization)
• Three Sisters companion planting (corn, beans, squash integration)
• Rice paddy ecosystem management (water buffalo, fish, duck integration)
• Permaculture food forest design (layered canopy, nitrogen fixation, perennial systems)

ANALYSIS REQUIREMENTS:
1. Systematic comparison methodology across all four systems
2. Ecological principles identification and explanation
3. Cultural knowledge transmission methods analysis
4. Climate adaptation and resilience assessment
5. Modern agriculture integration possibilities
6. Cultural preservation and intellectual property considerations

STRUCTURED DELIVERABLES:
• Comparative analysis matrix (4 systems x 6 criteria)
• Ecological principles synthesis with scientific explanation
• Cultural transmission analysis with preservation recommendations
• Climate resilience assessment with adaptation strategies
• Integration framework for modern agriculture
• Cultural protection and ethical guidelines

OUTPUT FORMAT:
- Executive summary of key findings
- Systematic comparison matrix
- Integrated ecological principles
- Implementation recommendations
- Cultural protection protocols

Provide comprehensive traditional agriculture analysis:
